Outreach Services

Mobile support services that meet people where they are, building trust and connections to help community members access housing, healthcare, and essential resources.

Home Programs & Services Outreach Services

What We Do

Our outreach team provides mobile support services throughout Northumberland County, connecting with individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of losing their housing. We meet people where they are, building relationships based on trust and respect while helping them access the resources they need to improve their circumstances.

Street Outreach

Our street outreach workers regularly visit areas where people experiencing homelessness may be staying, including parks, transit stations, and other public spaces. We provide immediate support, assess needs, and help connect people to appropriate services and resources.

Mobile Outreach Unit

Our specially equipped mobile unit brings services directly to the community. The unit carries essential supplies, communication equipment, and resources to provide immediate support and facilitate connections to longer-term services.

Follow-up Support

We don't just make one-time connections. Our team provides ongoing follow-up support to help people navigate services, attend appointments, and work toward their goals for stable housing and improved well-being.

Quick Information

Operating Hours

  • Monday - Sunday: 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM
  • Extended hours during extreme weather
  • 24/7 crisis response available

Service Area

All communities across Northumberland County, including rural and urban areas.

Request Outreach

Call for outreach services or to report someone in need:

(905) 555-HELP

Get More Information

Services We Provide

Our outreach team offers comprehensive support designed to meet immediate needs while working toward longer-term stability.

Immediate Support

  • • Food, water, and snacks
  • • Blankets and warm clothing
  • • Personal hygiene items
  • • First aid and basic medical care
  • • Crisis intervention

Resource Connection

  • • Emergency shelter placement
  • • Healthcare referrals
  • • Mental health services
  • • Addiction treatment programs
  • • Income support applications

Housing Support

  • • Housing applications assistance
  • • Rent supplement programs
  • • Landlord liaison support
  • • Move-in assistance
  • • Tenancy skill building

Documentation Help

  • • ID replacement assistance
  • • ODSP/OW applications
  • • Health card renewals
  • • Banking support
  • • Legal document assistance

Transportation

  • • Rides to appointments
  • • Transit passes and tokens
  • • Transportation to services
  • • Emergency transportation
  • • Service location directions

Advocacy

  • • Service navigation support
  • • Rights and entitlements education
  • • Complaint resolution
  • • System advocacy
  • • Empowerment and skill building

How to Access Outreach Services

Our outreach services are available to anyone experiencing or at risk of homelessness in Northumberland County.

Call for Yourself

If you need support or services, call us directly. Our team will work with you to understand your situation and provide appropriate assistance.

(905) 555-HELP

Refer Someone

If you're concerned about someone who may need support, you can request an outreach visit. We'll approach the person respectfully and offer assistance.

Call or email us with:

  • • Location information
  • • Description of concerns
  • • Best times for contact

All Services Are Free

There is no cost for outreach services. We respect confidentiality and work at the pace that feels right for each individual.

Request Outreach Services Ask Questions
